channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CO

item.title: Report X-2023090429
item.description:
Report X-2023090429

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-03T15:13:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-08
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Metal aerosol cans in corrugated carton without dividers. No hazard markings on exterior. One can dented and cracked at base by impact with adjacent can. Contents spilled, soiling other cans and damaging carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Plastic jugs in corrugated carton with corrugated top liner panel. Loose caps on all four jugs allowed leakage which damaged carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

item.title: Report X-2023090414
item.description:
Report X-2023090414

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-03
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered leaking in the unload. Package was brought to QA for inspection. Upon inspection, contents were found with all four containers having loose caps and having each at least slightly leaked. DescribePack: All four caps were slightly loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a damage tote with orientation arrows being followed.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: pieces were placed in plastic hazmat bags, placed in hazmat totes, and put in hazmat cage for further processing.

item.title: Report E-2023090718
item.description:
Report E-2023090718

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-25
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UDV experienced a UN1814 Tigre release from a 52-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 cup of material released to a 10’ x 4’ area of the trailer floor. The drum that released was shipped onto the customer by XPO prior to contractors’ arrival. The crew utilized vinegar solution to neutralize the impacted area. Absorbents were then deployed to collect all material and containerized into a 30-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023100016
item.description:
Report E-2023100016

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-03T15:13:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-29
  • City: GRAND JUNCTION
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal UGJ. It was reported that an unknown quantity of Sikadur 42 Grout Pak (UN3267) was released from (1) 1- gallon metal pail due to a puncture from a nail in the pallet. A network contractor was dispatched to assist in cleaning. All waste was left onsite for XPO to manage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: This hazmat was discovered leaking by a preload unload manager. The manager placed hazmat in plastic bag/black bin and stored it in QA1. The pkg was upside down. DescribePack: All four jugs had loose caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The pkg was placed right side up in a plastic bag/bin and processed in fumigator.

DurationRel: 40 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. was placed inside a lined tote and was taken to hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023082022
item.description:
Report X-2023082022

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Steel drum with lug-type removable head and pail-style handle . No arrows on exterior. Top and bottom rims of drum and head dented, compromising seal and allowing leakage which damaged exterior labels. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

item.title: Report X-2023081963
item.description:
Report X-2023081963

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T18:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-26
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Metal paint cans in doublewall corrugated carton with corrugated liners and dividers. Only two lid clips per can. Lid lifted on one can and allowed contents to spill, soiling all cans and damaging carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.
